alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 3:36PM MST until May 20 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Along Turkey Creek and Black Canyon in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Turkey Creek, North Fork Rock Creek, Castle Creek, Poland Creek, Sycamore Creek, Government Spring Wash, Rock Creek, Black Canyon, Crazy Basin Creek, Cedar Creek, Antelope Creek and Mineral Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County - This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 247 and 249. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
